Package renderer

Class RayTracerBasic

java.lang.Object
renderer.RayTracerBase
renderer.RayTracerBasic
public class RayTracerBasic
extends RayTracerBase
child class of RayTracerBase, that is used to determine color of a view plane pixel from which we casted a ray.

  • Field Summary

    private static double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K

  • Field Details

    • MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL

      private static final int MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL
      MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL is the amount of levels we allow the recursive calculation of light to run for. MIN_CALC_COLOR_K the k below which we consider a coefficient insignificant and consider it as zero. INITIAL_K is the constant that scales the coefficients in our calculations by zero to one (zero - use none its value, one - use all of its value).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MIN_CALC_COLOR_K

      private static final double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • INITIAL_K

      private static final double INITIAL_K
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • traceRay

      public Color traceRay​(Ray ray)
      Finds the color of the ray traveling through this scene.
      Specified by:
      traceRay in class RayTracerBase
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray to trace
      Returns:
      The resulting colour.

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint gp, Ray ray)
      calculates the color at a given point given the ray that intersects the point.
      Parameters:
      gp - the geo-point representing the point for which we want the color at.
      ray - the ray that intersected the point.
      Returns:
      the color at the given point.

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint intersection, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      recursive function to find the color of an intersection.
      Parameters:
      intersection - the intersection to find the color of.
      ray - the ray that intersected the intersection point.
      level - the level of the recursion.
      k - the current k coefficient of the color.
      Returns:
      the color of the intersection

    • calcGlobalEffects

      private Color calcGlobalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint gp, Vector v, int level, double k)
      calculates the color to add from global effects in the scene like reflections/refractions of light rays
      Parameters:
      gp - the point for which to calculate the color for.
      v - the direction vector from the camera to the point.
      level - the current level of the recursion.
      k - the current k coefficient of the color.
      Returns:
      the color added by the global effects in the scene.

    • calcGlobalEffect

      private Color calcGlobalEffect​(Ray ray, int level, double kx, double kkx)
      gets a reflected or refracted ray, and calculates color added from that ray.
      Parameters:
      ray - the reflected or refracted ray.
      level - the current level of the recursion.
      kx - kx coefficient value.
      kkx - kkx coefficient value.
      Returns:
      the color added from the given ray.

    • calcLocalEffects

      private Color calcLocalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint intersection, Ray ray, double k)
      calculates the local light effects color at an intersection point
      Parameters:
      k - the coefficient of the color
      intersection - the point for which we want the local light effects color
      ray - the ray from camera through view plane that intersects our point
      Returns:
      the local light effects color at the given point

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, Vector l, Vector n, Color lightIntensity)
      calculates the diffusive light color at a point given the diffuse coefficient, direction of the light, normal vector from the point, and the light intensity color.
      Parameters:
      kd - diffuse coefficient
      l - direction of the light
      n - normal vector from the point
      lightIntensity - light intensity color
      Returns:
      the diffusive light color at the point

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, Vector v, int nShininess, Color lightIntensity)
      calculates the specular light color at a point given the specular coefficient, direction of the light, normal vector from the point, direction from the camera to the point, shininess of the point, and the light intensity color.
      Parameters:
      ks - specular coefficient
      l - direction of the light
      n - normal vector from the point
      v - direction from the camera to the point
      nShininess - shininess of the point
      lightIntensity - light intensity color
      Returns:
      the specular light color at the point

    • unshaded

      private boolean unshaded​(LightSource light, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp)
      checks if a given point is shaded from a given light source by another object in the scene
      Parameters:
      light - the light to check if shaded from
      l - the direction of the light
      n - normal vector from the point
      gp - geo-point representing the point for which we are checking if it is shaded from the light
      Returns:
      true if unshaded by another object and false if shaded

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource ls, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint)
      checks if a given point is shaded from a given light source by another object in the scene and measures how much light (if any) passes through the obstructing object and reaches the point.
      Parameters:
      ls - the light source for which we are testing if its light gets to the point
      l - the direction of the light source
      n - normal vector from the point
      geoPoint - geo-point representing the point for which we are checking if and how much it is shaded from the light source
      Returns:
      a number between 0 and 1 representing how much light reaches the point. 1 is all of the light, and 0 is none of it.

    • constructReflectedRay

      private Ray constructReflectedRay​(Point3D point, Vector v, Vector n)
      constructs a reflected ray given the point of reflection, the original rays direction, and the normal vector at the point.
      Parameters:
      point - the reflection point
      v - the direction of the original ray.
      n - the normal vector at the point of reflection.
      Returns:
      a ray that is the original ray reflected off of the reflection point and elevated by a small delta.

    • constructRefractedRay

      private Ray constructRefractedRay​(Point3D point, Vector v, Vector n)
      constructs a refracted ray given a refraction point, the original rays direction and the normal vector at the point.
      Parameters:
      point - the refraction point.
      v - the original rays direction.
      n - the normal vector at the refraction point.
      Returns:
      a ray that is the original ray refracted off of the refraction point and lowered by a small delta.

    • findPerpendicular

      private Vector findPerpendicular​(Vector n)
      Finds some vector that's perpendicular to the given.
      Parameters:
      n - Said given vector to find a perpendicular vector for.
      Returns:
      The resulting vector.

    • calcGlossyDiffuse

      private Color calcGlossyDiffuse​(Ray ray, double radius, int level, double k, double kk)
      calculates the average color around a given ray's intersection - for the glossy or defuse effect of the material.
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray to calculate average color around its intersection.
      radius - the radius the cone of rays around the original ray
      level - level parameter to send to calcGlobalEffect
      k - k parameter to send to calcGlobalEffect
      kk - kk parameter to send to calcGlobalEffect
      Returns:
      the average color around the given ray's intersection.

    • getRingRegularPolygonVertices

      private java.util.ArrayList<Point3D> getRingRegularPolygonVertices​(Point3D center, double radius, int numVertices, Vector axis)
      calculate the vertices of two equally sided regular polygons one inside the other where the smaller one has half of its larger counterpart's radius - forming a ring shape. the function requires the large polygon's center, radius, axis vector, and number of vertices.
      Parameters:
      center - point representing the center of the polygons
      radius - the radius of the large outer polygon
      numVertices - desired number of vertices in the outer and inner polygon
      axis - axis vector of the polygons
      Returns:
      returns a list of points that are the regular polygons' vertices.

    • findClosestIntersection

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint findClosestIntersection​(Ray ray)
      finds the closest intersection with the ray that's closest to the base of the ray
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray to intersect and find closest intersection to its base
      Returns:
      the closest intersection to base of the given ray
